Description: A hollow terracotta head of Sarapis, broken from a figure, or more probably a bust, with a modius decorated with branches, probably of olive, at the front and sides. Modelled in the round. Two-piece mould. Grey-buff clay, with white inclusions; red-brown slip overall.
Curator's comments: Terracotta IV Purchased: Greville J. Chester. Acquired in the Fayum. Roman, probably second or third century AD. Comparanda: Close: Breccia 1930: no. 244, from the Hadra cemetery, Alexandria; Christie’s South Kensington 'Sale Catalogue', 5 October 2000: lot 345 (very large); Ewigleben and von Grumbkow 1991: no. 5; Hornbostel 1973: pl. cxlvi:239; Schmidt 1994: no. 281, dated second century BC; Schmidt 2005: 299; Schürmann 1989: no. 1018, dated second half of second century AD. Near: Breccia 1930: no. 248, from the Kom el-Shugafa cemetery, Alexandria; Dunand 1990: no. 465, from Antinoopolis, dated second to third century AD; Fischer 1994: no. 777, dated end of second to third century AD = Vogt 1924: pl. iii:7; Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge, e.125.1904, from Herakleopolis Magna = Petrie 1905: pl. xlvi:18 and Ashton et al. 2004: no. 40, dated first to second century ad; Hilton Price 1897: 401, no. 3324, from Bubastis; Hornbostel 1973: pl. cxlvi:236; Joly 1995: pl. lii:8; Kaufmann 1913: fig. 20; Pingiatoglou 1993: no. 12, dated third century AD; uclia, Gayer Anderson Bequest, ucl 1306; Vogt 1924: pl. iv:3. Bibliog: Fischer 1994: 321, no. 777.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3029)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
